action.name: Mobile
action.helpHtml: Unique for Rapid Mobile applications, this action allows you to perform a multitude of mobile actions, such as dialing a number, sending a text, taking a picture, or scanning a barcode or QR code.

property.name: Type
property.helpHtml: Defines the type of mobile action that will be carried out, such as dialing a number, scanning a barcode or sending a GPS location.

property.name: Phone number source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the phone number is coming from on the page.

property.name: Phone number source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the phone number source. An example of use would be getting the phone number from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Email address source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the email address is coming from on the page.

property.name: Email address source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the email address source. An example of use would be getting the email address from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Subject source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the email subject is coming from on the page.

property.name: Email source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the email subject source. An example of use would be getting the email subject from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Phone number source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the phone number is coming from on the page.

property.name: Phone number source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the phone number source. An example of use would be getting the phone number from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Message source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the message is coming from on the page.

property.name: Message source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the message source. An example of use would be getting the message from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: URL source
property.helpHtml: Sets where the URL is coming from on the page.

property.name: URL source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the URL source. An example of use would be getting the URL from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Gallery control
property.helpHtml: Selects which gallery control to use on the page. You will need to have a gallery control on the page in order to use this.

property.name: Max width/height (px)
property.helpHtml: Sets the maximum height and width of the gallery. By default it sets to 500 pixels in length and width.

property.name: Quality (%)
property.helpHtml: Sets the quality of the image, in percentages. By default it sets the quality to 50% of that of the original.

property.name: Controls
property.helpHtml: Sets the gallery or signature control on the page to put the image in to.

property.name: Destinations
property.helpHtml: Sets the destination for where to place the barcode data on the page.

property.name: Success actions
property.helpHtml: Allows you to set a success action for when the image is successfully imported into the control specified.

property.name: Error actions
property.helpHtml: Allows you to set an error action for when the image is not successfully imported into the control specified.

property.name: Navigate to source
property.helpHtml: The control that holds the data of where we want to navigate to.

property.name: Navigate to source field
property.helpHtml: Defines a more specific field for the source of where we want to navigate to. An example of use would be from a table cell within a table, where the cell is the field and the table is the source.

property.name: Navigate to search fields
property.helpHtml: Fields in the navigate to source control to use to search for the location to navigate to.

property.name: Navigation mode
property.helpHtml: Sets the type of transport being used to navigate, such as public transport.

property.name: Message
property.helpHtml: Sets a message to display in the status bar.

property.name: Destinations
property.helpHtml: Sets which control on the page will hold the GPS location sent.

property.name: Update frequency
property.helpHtml: Sets the number of seconds between the latest GPS position being sent. A value of 0 means the position will only be sent once.

property.name: Check GPS enabled
property.helpHtml: Sets whether to check if the mobile device has GPS enabled or not.

property.name: Actions
property.helpHtml: Allows you to define actions to be carried out if the mobile device has an established Internet connection.

property.name: Working dialogue
property.helpHtml: Sets a page to appear as dialogue if the mobile device is connected online.

property.name: Offline dialogue
property.helpHtml: Sets a page to appear as dialogue if the mobile device is not connected to the Internet.
